assessmentItem.title: Apply the Factor Theorem and use Synthetic Division

div.p:
The curve
y = mQues
\[y = \qv{mQues}\]
crosses the x-axis at (, 0).
div.div:
Find
The value of ,
The y-coordinate of the point where the curve crosses the y-axis,
The x-coordinate of one of the other points where the curve crosses the x-axis.

div.feedbackInline: No, the value you entered for has the wrong sign.
Well done, that's the correct value for .
Your value for the intercept on the y-axis is incorrect.
No, the value you entered for the intercept on the y-axis has the wrong sign.
Well done, that's the correct value for the intercept on the y-axis .
No, the curve does not cross the x-axis at (, 0).
No, the value you entered has the wrong sign.
Well done, the curve crosses the x-axis at (, 0).
Please enter a value in each box, then submit your answer.

feedbackBlock.p: You have had three attempts at answering this question, so here is the solution:

li.p: The graph crosses the x-axis at (, 0), so () is a factor of .

The graph crosses the y-axis where
x = 0
\[x = 0\]
, i.e. when
y = iK
\[y = \qv{iK}\]
.
To find the other points where the graph crosses the x-axis, we divide by (), using synthetic division:
Hence the graph cuts the y-axis at (, 0), (, 0) and (, 0).

feedbackBlock.p: Apply the Factor Theorem to find the value of .
Along the y-axis, x is zero and along the x-axis, y is zero.
Use synthetic division to obtain a quadratic which gives you the other roots.
Since you have viewed the solution, your score for this question will be 0.
Since you have viewed the hint, your score for this question will be halved.
